jdraw.framework
Interface DrawModel

public interface DrawModel

The class DrawModel represents the model of a drawing, i.e. all figures stored in a graphic. Every draw view refers to a model.

Version:
2.5
Author:
Dominik Gruntz & Christoph Denzler
See Also:
DrawView

Method Detail

addFigure

void addFigure(Figure f)
Adds a new figure to the draw model.

Parameters:
f - figure to be added to draw model.

removeFigure

void removeFigure(Figure f)
Removes a given figure from the draw model.

Parameters:
f - figure to be removed from draw model.

removeAllFigures

void removeAllFigures()
Remove all figures from the draw model. This method is used when loading a drawing from a file in order to clear the old drawing before loading the new one.

getFigures

Iterable<Figure> getFigures()
Returns an iterator which can be used to iterate over all figures of a draw model. The iterator ordering is the order in which elements were inserted into the model (insertion-order). The order is interpreted by the view as "back-to-front".

Returns:
iterator to iterate over the draw model

addModelChangeListener

void addModelChangeListener(DrawModelListener listener)
Adds the specified model listener to receive model events from this draw model.

Parameters:
listener - the draw model listener.
See Also:
DrawModelListener

removeModelChangeListener

void removeModelChangeListener(DrawModelListener listener)
Removes the specified model listener so that it no longer receives model events from this draw model. This method performs no function, nor does it throw an exception, if the listener specified by the argument was not previously added to this figure.

Parameters:
listener - the draw model listener.
See Also:
DrawModelListener

getDrawCommandHandler

DrawCommandHandler getDrawCommandHandler()
Returns the draw command handler provided by this model.

Returns:
the draw command handler used.
See Also:
DrawCommandHandler

setFigureIndex

void setFigureIndex(Figure f,
                    int index)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                           IndexOutOfBoundsException
Sets the index of a given figure. If the figure is moved to a new place, then the model sends a DRAWING_CHANGED event to all registered model listeners.

Parameters:
f - the figure whose index has to be set
index - the position at which the new figure should appear. The other figures are moved away.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the figure is not contained in the model.
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range ( index < 0 || index > size()) where size() is the number of figures contained in the model.
